trans-unit.target: A simple wooden hairpin treasured by young Aunillie of the Acorn Orchard.
A sturdy box filled with a set of pristine carpentry tools.
A single red Azeyma rose entrusted to you by Ethelred.
A small metal bit used in a set of chocobo reins. There appear to be several deep bite marks in the iron...
A spherical candy confected to shine like a fire crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like a wind crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like an earth crystal.
The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.
A festive lantern carved from a pumpkin, used to ward off evil spirits during All Saints' Wake.
The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.
A handheld firework that unleashes a dazzling display of sparks.
A spherical candy confected to shine like a fire crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like a wind crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like an earth crystal.
The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.

The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.
A handheld firework that unleashes a dazzling display of sparks.
A spherical candy confected to shine like a fire crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like a wind crystal.
A spherical candy confected to shine like an earth crystal.
The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.
A festive lantern carved from a pumpkin, used to ward off evil spirits during All Saints' Wake.
The disembodied finger of a voidsent bomb.
A handheld firework that unleashes a dazzling display of sparks.
A sharply scented liquid entrusted to you by Master Gabineaux of Gabineaux's Bower.
This translucent sac appears to be filled with thousands of tiny pearl-shaped eggs.
This melon-sized egg of the violent scalekin known as the anole is still slightly warm.
Mother Miounne's realm-famous eel pie. Served only in her fine establishment, the Carline Canopy.
A hempen bag filled halfway with ripe Mun<var 1F /var>Tuy beans.
A sweetly scented letter dropped by Ailbert.
A tender, fleshy leaf taken from a microchu.
A message entrusted to you at the Archers' Guild by an adventurer calling herself F'mibhas.
A large bag filled with various dried meats and fruit entrusted to you by a hardened adventurer named Celestine.
The bone of some large mammal whittled down to a sharp point.
One part softened beeswax mixed with two parts olive oil. Used to treat leather.
A thick, sturdy rope twisted from common brambleweed.
The bitter fruit of an Azeyma rose.
Leafy greens originating from the Near East. If they were any fresher, they would still be in the ground.
These hard black seeds can remain dormant for years before sprouting.
Little time has elapsed since this strand was spun, and so the web remains extremely sticky.
A potent liquor created through the fermentation of hornet carcasses.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood.
You must deliver this egg, adventurer. It's our only hope!
A stained envelope entrusted to you by realm-renowned wrangler Keitha of Bentbranch Meadows.
A viscous yet odorless secretion taken from the underbelly of a common ladybug.
The carcasses of common hornets. The stingers are still intact.
Having been left uncovered for a few days, this cheap Aleport brew has lost all of its bubbles.
A fragrant oil pressed from freshly harvested Azeyma rose hips.
A heavy stone used by the Wood Wailers for training with the lance.
A flask of brownish oil you received from Brother E<var 1F /var>Sumi<var 1F /var>Yan. It reeks of decayed earth.
An instrument widely used in maritime navigation. This one appears to have been a victim of the elements.
An instrument widely used in maritime navigation. This one appears to have been a victim of the elements.
Mother Miounne's realm-famous eel pie. Served only in her fine establishment, the Carline Canopy.
Mother Miounne's realm-famous eel pie. Served only in her fine establishment, the Carline Canopy.
A flask of water drawn from the banks of a pristine lake in the East Shroud.
A heavy stone used by the Wood Wailers for training with the lance.
These lighter-than-air spheres of concentrated lightning can be used to power magitek terminals.
This translucent sac appears to be filled with thousands of tiny, pearl-shaped eggs.
An old Order of the Twin Adder jacket, stained with the blood of its former owner.
A healthy looking honeybee...or at least it would be healthy if you hadn't killed it.
A viscous coating covers this leaf taken from a landtrap.
Pelts taken from beasts unlawfully hunted by Coeurlclaw poachers.
This unmarked envelope contains a missive penned by local businessman Wymond.
A notice singing the praises of one Franz the Fair─an extremely popular gladiator, as can be noted by the excessive use of exclamation marks.
The bristly hide of a snapping shrew.
This old flaxen bag contains something soft and warm...
A sprawling list of numbers which appear to be coordinates of some sort.
The rock-hard carapace of a bog yarzon.
A variety of fungus found in Peacegarden that naturally emits a soft white glow.
These tiny vilekin gather on the young leaves of various forest foliage to feed.
A wooden box containing various tools used by surveyors, including an alidade, a plumb, and a block of marking wax.
A thin rope used by surveyors to measure distance.
Items prepared and packaged to ship from Vesper Bay to the East Aldenard Trading Company.
Actually, this clear liquid is far closer to water than it is blood...except, that is, for the cactuar it is taken from. For him it is most definitely blood.
The piece is quite warm from having sat under the Thanalan sun. Hopefully there is nothing perishable inside.
It is believed that each gill can hold up to ten score spores.
When dried and made into a rope, a single microchu vine can support a full-grown Roegadyn.
An ordinary-looking stone that will adhere itself to certain types of metal.
From its condition, it can be gathered that this lure was gnawed on by more than one denizen of the deep.
It's best if one does not ask exactly how this oil was extracted from a coblyn.
A sincere note of thanks from the sweet-voiced Kikipu of the Silver Bazaar.
The hard, jagged jaw of an antling worker.
The large, curved rib of a hammer beak.
Several chunks of silver which have grown together to form a sizable cluster.
The large, curved rib of a hammer beak.
The Twelve only know how many fish have been caught with this antique rod.
Information regarding a suspicious individual compiled by Roseline of the Wood Wailers.
Information regarding a suspicious individual compiled by Roseline of the Wood Wailers.
Information regarding a suspicious individual compiled by Roseline of the Wood Wailers.
A deep clay bowl filled with cold water.
A tattered leather satchel you found lying near a gutted campfire.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
Not actually a plum, and not actually a thousand years old, but this fruit does only grow on the Guardian Tree─an arboreal specimen known for its longevity.
An earthy-smelling medicine created by budding alchemist Alewyn Alder.
The crack was there before you found it. Honest.
The faint aroma of prosperity can be detected on this freshly minted gil.
Exchange this slip at the Royal Plantations for one ripe pumpkin.
If cured properly, antelope meat can be stored for up to three summers.
A small piece of parchment detailing an order for a gaudy circlet.
A simple wooden box containing several handfuls of Mun<var 1F /var>Tuy beans─a favorite of Black Shroud lemurs.
An unusually small cane you found lying upon a stump.
An unusually small cane you found lying upon a stump.
An unlocked box containing several basic tools employed by hunters to trap their prey.
When making an offering of antelope innards to the spirits of the wood, it is proper if they are still warm.
The tender, green young leaves of an ochu.
The flavor of shrew meat is only bearable if it is prepared within six bells of its harvest. Even then, it still must be blended with strong spices and smoked to be considered even remotely edible.
Several chunks of silver which have grown together to form a sizable cluster.
Thick cuts of orobon so fresh you can eat it raw...but probably shouldn't unless you enjoy parasites.
The warm blood of a bipedal sentient. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
A metal-clad lockbox used in transporting expensive ores from the Concern's mines back to Ul'dah.
An important message entrusted to you by Naldiq & Vymelli's forgemaster, H'naanza with orders to deliver it to <var 1A 02 /var>Victory<var 1A 01 /var> shipwright Ahtbyrm.
Boiled boar, stewed dodo, steamed cabbage, a slab of stone cheese, and a hunch of day-old bread─everything a hardworking shipwright needs to maintain his (or her) vigor.
These white-hot cores are sometimes used by blacksmiths and armorers as a source of heat when driving rivets into metal plate.
The brownish yellow stain on this sharp tooth suggests a diet rich in carrion.
With a decent wind, the stench of rotting dodo meat can carry for malms, attracting all manner of creatures.
A piece of nautical equipment intended for the <var 1A 02 /var>Victory<var 1A 01 /var> and sought after by shipwright Fyrilsmyd.
A piece of nautical equipment intended for the <var 1A 02 /var>Victory<var 1A 01 /var> and sought after by shipwright Fyrilsmyd.
A piece of nautical equipment intended for the <var 1A 02 /var>Victory<var 1A 01 /var> and sought after by shipwright Fyrilsmyd.
A lovely flower for the lovely Ghimthota.
A piece of pottery dating back to an age when the city<var 1F /var>state of Gelmorra prospered.
An ornately decorated sword found thrust into Lifemend Stump.
Though yarzons are said to be attracted to the stench of most any kind of rotting flesh, they become especially excited when that flesh is of a fellow vilekin.
A small, high-pitched whistle that hunters use to mimic bird calls and send signals to their companions.
This aged honey liquor has a faint bouquet of roses...and ochus.
This tiny finger taken from a voidsent balloon is hot to the touch.
A stained order slip used by Coffer & Coffin wenches who have difficulty remembering all the demands of their customers.
A highly toxic liquid entrusted to you by the rogue lancer Foulques.
It appears the poor soul who tried to harvest this tusk before you was not so fortunate.
Though the crate is splintered in several places, it does not appear that its contents were damaged in the fall.
It is believed that after eating pumpkin for the first time, the sultana fell in love with the nutty flavor and ordered all her royal plantations grow the vegetable.
Straight from good Wystan's pocket. (Don't mind the lint.)
A sealed envelope entrusted to you by Bentbranch Meadows chocobokeep Luquelot.
A slip of paper indicating the various departure and arrival times of Amajina & Sons Mineral Concern freight trains.
Gysahl greens picked fresh from the gardens at Bentbranch Meadows.
The warm blood of a bipedal sentient. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
These accursed beads exude a powerful aura of death and suffering.
One look at this extravagant ring would make anyone question Didilata's mother's taste in finery.
Fishing bait delivered to the Mirror Planks.
Dried Mun-Tuy beans delivered to the Mirror Planks.
An unblemished suit of steel plate armor delivered to the Mirror Planks.
A sealed envelope entrusted to you by Mother Miounne of the Carline Canopy.
As long as the lock is intact, we may never know for certain what Timbermaster Beatin placed inside.
Evidence proving unlawful hunting in the Twelveswood.
A wooden box filled with items stolen by goblin robbers.
A chunk of stone that was once animated using arcane magicks.
These rock-hard cores are oft used to stabilize loose earth, making land safer to build upon.
Merchandise pilfered by Ser Baron von Quiveron III Esquire and his blundering attendants.
While not very pleasing to the palate, cactus leaves provide adequate nourishment when there is naught else save coblyn legs to eat.
The magick-imbued heart of a golem.
Illegal what-nots peddled by the goblins of Skull Valley.
The arcane text scrawled upon this page appears to have been written in blood. Could it be a clue to breaking the area's sealed barrier?
A small metal key used to unlock doors in Haukke Manor.
A snow white lily is painted upon this key found in Haukke Manor.
A blood red rose is painted upon this key found in Haukke Manor.
A green ivy leaf is painted upon this key found in Haukke Manor.
A bright-yellow carnation is painted upon this key found in Haukke Manor.
A sample of maple harvested for the Greatloam Growery's study of treant behavior.
A sample of maple harvested for the Greatloam Growery's study of treant behavior.
Unlike the seeds of normal, healthy trees, acorns fallen from treants have a habit of exploding.
Upon further inspection of the trunk's rings, it appears this young ash tree has seen fewer than five summers.
Upon further inspection of the branch's rings, it appears this young ash tree has seen fewer than five summers.
This variety of Tinolqa mistletoe is normally found growing on the east bank of the West Vein.
Large cuts of dry wood, perfect for maintaining campfires, bonfires, cookfires, and signal fires.
Small cuts of dry wood, perfect for starting campfires, bonfires, cookfires, and signal fires.
This sticky white tree sap contains not a single impurity.
This sticky white tree sap is peppered with tiny vilekin and pieces bark.
Large pieces cut away from tall ash trees to allow sunshine to reach lower lying vegetation.
Leaf-laden branches cut away from tall ash trees to allow sunshine to reach lower lying vegetation.
A sublime sample of perfectly straight and round ash timber.
A gnarled root taken from a variety of cyclopean tree known as heavenspillars.
A chunk of hard bark taken from a variety of cyclopean tree known as heavenspillars.
A thick healthy root taken from a variety of cyclopean tree known as heavenspillars.
If left to germinate, these seeds will eventually grow into an ochu.
Though devoid of any moisture, this leaf still twitches slightly.
A thin veil of white spores have been dusted across the uneven surface of this bark.
This thick piece of bark is riddled with countless tiny tunnels dug by hungry vilekin larvae.
A plump Gridanian chestnut.
A bruised and blackened Gridanian chestnut. Only suitable for consumption by worms, hogs, and possibly hungry Qiqirn.
The golden color of this Gridanian chestnut is prized by patisseries across the realm.
This variety of Tinolqa mistletoe is normally found growing on the west bank of the West Vein.
A long, straight ash log that will most likely prove difficult for chocobos to jump over, even if over half is buried.
While sufficiently long and straight, this ash long is far too thin to be effective if used to construct a fence.
These hard black seeds can remain dormant for years before sprouting.
Judging from its state of decay, this roselet leaf appears to have fallen from its host long ago.
This hard seed has split down the middle─a single root now protruding from one end, a bright-green bud from the other.
A swift growing weed that produces tiny white flowers similar in appearance to Jessamine, but with a foul scent that attracts only flies.
A medicinal herb known for the fragrant aroma of its tiny white flowers. Not to be confused with quickweed.
Sap so pure, it will not require filtering before boiling down into syrup.
Sap so filled with impurities, it will require several trips through a filter before it can be considered of a quality suitable for making syrup.
The mark of the primal Ramuh has been burned deeply into this piece of bark.
A large colony slow-growing moss so soft that sylphs have often been seen sleeping upon it.
A colorless, odorless liquid extracted from the massive, thorned foliage growing in the Bramble Patch.
This thorn, cut from the dense foliage covering the Bramble Patch, is almost as large as a Lalafell.

Boiled, baked, roasted, or even fermented, there are scores of ways to prepare Mun-Tuy beans─a staple amongst forest dwellers since the first tribes arrived generations ago. When dried and stored properly, the beans will last indefinitely.
A flower so breathtaking, that it is said even an Ixal will stop to gaze at its beauty.
A scarred section of root that has been exposed to the elements.
A shriveled section of root that has been removed from the tree whence it grew.
A thick section of root, moist to the touch.
The oils produced within these newly formed buds are highly fragrant, making them perfect for flavoring cakes and liquors.
As galago mint leaves mature, the oils produced within the leaves evaporate, making them less fragrant than their younger counterparts.
A faded bronze piece, stamped with the seal of the ancient subterranean city<var 1F /var>state of Gelmorra.
Countless seasons of exposure to the elements have resulted in the blue-green coating this unidentifiable piece of metal now carries.
From end to end, this tree branch is almost as long as a full-grown Roegadyn is tall.
If allowed to decay further, these leaves will make for good, rich soil.
Though extremely deadly if consumed, the juice taken from crushed soldier's sore berries can be used to create a deep-red paint that closely resembles the color of fresh blood.
The razor-like edges of these thick leaves are sharp enough to slice through skin, hence the name “soldier's sore.”
A sister of the faerie apple developed by the Greatloam Growery to better withstand the elements, while yielding larger harvests.
Though no larger than a Lalafellin mustache, this voracious vilekin can consume up to a score of leaves in a single bell.
A queer-looking fungus not native to the Twelveswood. It could be edible, but so far, no one has had the courage to be the first to find out.
A long, wooden peg covered in mushroom spores and driven into a healthy tree with hopes that the spores will take root.
A simple wooden weapon used in Wood Wailer training exercises. The tip is too blunt to induce any serious injury.
These bags contain a pungent mixture of peat moss, rotting leaves, chocobo dung, and growth formula gamma. It's what plants crave.
A pulsating egg pulled from a mite hole.
A delicate mushroom that tastes divine in stews.
Used by poachers, these deadly traps injure more Lalafells than they do beastkin.
A magicked tincture used to soothe the savage beast.
Tender, lean antelope meat suitable for drying.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Olidious Separation,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
It may make you go blind, but at least it is chilled.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “The Beholders,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Brand of the Impure,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
A large, heavy egg with a seemingly unbreakable shell.
Hides taken from beasts unlawfully hunted by Coeurlclaw poachers.
These concentrated cores of suspended water can put out even the hottest of flames, including ones crafted by imps to hide their true forms.
The fine powder attached to this cluster is sure to send any man, woman...or imp, for that matter, into a sneezing fit.
Tender white meat suited for sautés. Tastes remarkably like chocobo.
Marinate overnight in a mixture of one part mead, one part fermented Mun-Tuy bean sauce, and then roast over an open flame for a delicious meal that is sure to impress.
A small diary found buried in Silent Arbor.
One of the packages forgotten on the transport balloon from Limsa Lominsa. It is addressed to one Syngithuv.
One of the packages forgotten on the transport balloon from Limsa Lominsa. It is addressed to one Jessamine.
These concentrated cores of suspended water can help maintain the freshness of recently caught fish.
It's what buzzards crave.
This strain of millioncorn has been bred over generations to grow in even the rockiest of soils.
When lit, this receptacle will not only produce light, but provide heat to the immediate area.
Unbearably hot to the touch, this remnant of a voidsent bomb will set aflame nearly anything it comes in contact with.
A plain-looking box believed to contain the effects of Lyulf's deceased father.
If left be, this warm, heavy egg would likely hatch in a matter of weeks.
Quite literally a steaming sack of shite.
Without tools like these, the tillers who frequent Tiller's Rest would have a hard time tilling.
Used by the tillers of Summerford to clear the land of rocks.
A sweet citrus fruit known to thrive in the temperate climate of middle La Noscea. This particular specimen seems to have thrived quite a bit.
The piece is quite warm from having sat under the Thanalan sun. Hopefully there is nothing perishable inside.
The piece is quite warm from having sat under the Thanalan sun. Hopefully there is nothing perishable inside.
This envelope contains a very special message from Oswell.
Beautiful plumage plucked from the rump of a slain hammer beak.
A burlap bag packed chock-full of juicy, ripe La Noscean oranges.
Payment for the sack of La Noscean oranges.
These sharp appendages each contain a single drop of poison. It is, however, extremely difficult to remove one from the carcass of a hornet without the drop spilling.
A firmly worded reminder of delivery from the jeweler Dadanen.
An extremely rare variety of malachite that gets its name from its deep green color─the same color as former Ul'dahn sultana Nanasha Ul Nasha's eyes.
This weathered pickaxe has seen countless years of use, yet is still as sharp as the day it was forged.
This weathered hammer has seen countless years of use, yet its owner has seen to it that the haft remains well varnished.
This weathered sledgehammer has seen countless years of use, and though dented and scratched, its iron head is still in fine condition.
A deadly trigger-activated device that Fufulupa wishes to use to catch a bandit.
Quite literally an <var 1A 02 /var>eye<var 1A 01 /var> of a <var 1A 02 /var>serpent<var 1A 01 /var>. Sought after by goldsmiths and jewelers across the realm for its ruby glow.
When thrown into fire, the stench emitted by this thick blood is foul enough to keep most beastkin at bay.
A sealed message written by Brass Blade Fufulupa of the Rose to his former captain Leofric.
An extremely rare variety of malachite that gets its name from its deep green color─the same color as former Ul'dahn sultana Nanasha Ul Nasha's eyes.
Not only does this viscous liquid keep toads cool in the harsh climes of Thanalan, but its toxicity protects the toads from being consumed by predators.
An envelope addressed to the miner Beringaer containing Hamund's application for employment.
This ornamental dagger has remained in possession of the Brass Blades of the Rose for centuries, traditionally passed down to a new captain when an old one retires.
One would not guess this succulent slice of lean meat came from a bird known for dining on decaying flesh.
If you can make it through the stone-hard shell, you will be treated with a sweet, buttery meat that is best eaten steamed.
Sailors who have traveled to the eastern islands beyond the Sea of Jade swear that the rubbery flesh of this shelled creature is best eaten raw.
The erudite Erasmus is convinced this frothy blood of a star marmot will help him better understand the life the now-deceased beastkin lived.
A slip of bound parchment entrusted to you by Quicksand proprietress Momodi Modi.
A slip of bound parchment entrusted to you by Quicksand proprietress Momodi Modi.
A slip of bound parchment entrusted to you by Quicksand proprietress Momodi Modi.
A strange slip of parchment found at the Amalj'aa encampment in eastern Thanalan.
A pure white stone sometimes used for lich stones.
A fragrant variety of lavender rarely found in the arid lowland regions of Thanalan.
The parchment reads, “Skilled carpenters sought to aid in the construction of a new inn. Fair wages promised. Workers must bring own tools.”
A pure white stone sometimes used for lich stones.
While not stagnant, this water is filled with impurities making it unsuitable for drinking (unless you are <var 1A 02 /var>extremely<var 1A 01 /var> thirsty).
A letter addressed to Sultansworn elite Owyne.
Caitlyn of Drybone's attempt to placate Azeyma the Warden.
A letter addressed to Sultansworn elite Owyne.
This poor soul appears to have been ravaged by an Amalj'aa before sitting to rot for several turns of the sun.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
A metal ring engraved with a scorpion, its tail poised ready to strike.
Approximately fourteen times more effective than a normal potion.
A metal ring engraved with a scorpion, its tail poised ready to strike.
Details of dealings made between the Alacran and the Corpse Brigade for the purchase of a deadly poison known as Rhalgr's Bile.
A tiny box carved from a single piece of rosewood.
This show of respect to the recently deceased is almost as withered as the corpse it now accompanies.
A potent liquor created through the fermentation of hornet carcasses. Its biting aroma is known to repel certain breeds of vilekin.
Not as toxic as the name would have you believe, and it tastes like chocobo!
A wooden dummy outfitted with several pegs. Basic training equipment for any aspiring pugilist.
A small wrapped parcel bound for the settlement of Horizon.
A terrible poison made famous when it was used to assassinate an Ala Mhigan king.
The parchment reads, “Skilled carpenters sought to aid in the construction of a new inn. Fair wages promised. Workers must bring own tools.”
An official-looking document detailing the seizure of a specified piece of property.
The heat of the Thanalan sun only makes the odor of this long-dead wavekin that much more unbearable.
Tender white meat suited for sautés. Tastes remarkably like chocobo.
A sturdy wooden crate filled with bottles of ether and copious amounts of packing hay.
This malodorous lifeblood is so dark a red, it almost appears black.
A sturdy wooden crate filled with bottles of ether and copious amounts of packing hay.
This malodorous lifeblood is so dark a red, it almost appears black.
The blood smeared about the head is still sticky to the touch.
This book appears to have been torn apart with something sharp like a claw.
A scientific study on the characteristics of the voidsent seductress known as Mormo.
Bent and faded beyond recognition, even the most desperate of beggars will pause before accepting this coin.
A scientific study on the characteristics of the voidsent seductress known as Mormo.
This square of parchment contains information on Cocobusi the Cross.
The soft, spongy liver of a river-dwelling gigantoad.
This burlap sack is filled to bursting with freshly shorn sheep fleece.
Finely ground flour milled at the Grey Fleet.
An order of garments bound for the people working at the Red Rooster Stead.
An order of garments bound for the people working at the Red Rooster Stead.
An order of garments bound for the people working at the Red Rooster Stead.
So much blood covers this piece of jewelry that it is impossible to tell from what it is made.
This simple wooden box entrusted to you by Skarnmhar of the Red Rooster Stead is heavy with rotting dodo meat.
What ever would you put in an empty dodo-sized sack?
What ever could be thrashing about in this dodo-sized sack?
A fine-toothed metal comb used to remove bloodsucking lice from sheep.
Ladybugs are known to feed on this sweet secretion.
The moss-green ooze which seeps out from the cracked shell after crushing an innocent, defenseless ladybug.
The aetherial balance of this crystal is tipped completely to the element earth. Not a single trace of any of the other five elements can be detected.
A small metal key used to unlock locked doors. How novel!
Blasting powder used to clear tunnels in mines, though six onzes is not nearly enough to cause any real damage.
Fuel used to light the streetlamps of Limsa Lominsa. It reeks of fish.
A letter addressed to Lominsan Admiral Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn.
A letter addressed to Gridanian Elder Seedseer Kan<var 1F /var>E<var 1F /var>Senna.
A common weed rumored to have relaxing properties when either ingested or smoked.
The only thing written on this slip of parchment appears to be a mess of squiggly lines and randomly positioned ink blots.
This booklet, penned by a log assessor from Mealvaan's Gate, contains the names of merchants who have yet to pay the duty on the goods they imported into Limsa Lominsa.
Lamb meat so fresh it still smells of the mother's teat.
A set containing several exotic spices and instructions on how they can be used. Not something you would expect from the captain of a band of bloodthirsty pirates.
A set containing several exotic spices and instructions on how they can be used. Not something you would expect from the captain of a band of bloodthirsty pirates.
A disturbingly long list of people who have gone missing in recent moons.
The soft gelatinous body of an aurelia. A delicacy in Othard where it is dried, then sliced and mixed with oil of sesame and dragon peppers.
A drawing of a man(?) pieced together from descriptions given by eyewitnesses to his crimes most heinous.
A letter addressed to Lominsan Admiral Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn.
A letter addressed to Ul'dahn Flame General Raubahn Aldynn.
A letter addressed to Gridanian Elder Seedseer Kan<var 1F /var>E<var 1F /var>Senna.
A letter addressed to Ul'dahn Flame General Raubahn Aldynn.
A piece of parchment containing prices from shops and stalls all over Limsa Lominsa.
This plain dagger has absolutely no defining characteristics except that the hilt does smell quite nice.
A once ordinary dagger, now made special with the wonders of materia.
A traditional Dunesfolk bread twisted into the shape of a knot and sprinkled generously with coarse-ground salt before being baked to a perfect brown resembling twilight over Thanalan.
Once removed from the sago palm trunk, the pith is crushed, kneaded, and washed to remove the starch. The starch collected is then dried and turned into flour.
This hard fleshy nut is edible only after removing the naturally occurring poisons─a process which requires days of soaking and boiling, followed by a full moon of drying in the La Noscean salt air.
A large dry leaf, brown from age and exposure to the sun.

When dried and prepared as a herbal infusion, this rare form of hibiscus will color the water bright red. This tincture is oft sold in apothecaries under the name “Wanderer's Blood” and is purported to cure everything from the gout to bunions.
The fruit of a palm which, before the Calamity, only grew on the Cieldalaes.
A simple rectangular brick used in the building of crude walls and barriers. It has not fared well against the elements.
A simple rectangular brick used in the building of crude walls and barriers.
An uneven slab of stone retrieved near the Eighty Sins of Sasamo. Countless summers of wind and sand have smoothed its surface and rounded its edges.
An uneven slab of stone retrieved near the Eighty Sins of Sasamo.
Rock containing a significant amount of the metal copper mixed with traces of iron and sulphur.
Rock made up largely of granite with an insignificant amount of copper.
A simple rectangular brick used in the building of crude walls and barriers. It has not fared well against the elements.
A simple rectangular brick used in the building of crude walls and barriers.
A slab of stone necessary for Marcette's studies.
A chunk of ore necessary for Marcette's studies.
There is little question this lump of earth contains no Nashachite.
Rock containing a significant amount of the metal zinc.
The years have not been kind to this stone which, at one time, was placed within a wall to strengthen it.
Excavated from ruins unearthed by the Calamity, this stone, once used to strengthen a wall from within, is still in pristine shape.
This heavy grey stone does not appear to contain any rare metals, let alone gold.
While shiny, this chunk of metallic ore does not appear to contain any gold.
Thin as parchment and light as dodo down, this piece of scalekin skin is also nearly transparent.
An uneven slab of stone retrieved in Nophica's Wells. Countless summers of wind and sand have smoothed its surface and rounded its edges.
An uneven slab of stone retrieved in Nophica's Wells.
This heavy grey stone does not appear to contain any rare metals, let alone mythril.
While lightweight and shiny, this chunk of metallic ore does not appear to contain any mythril.
Beware of traveling mountebanks claiming these ordinary rocks have the power to cure all ailments by neutralizing negative humours with spiritual energies.
A solid granite block large enough to be carved into a good-sized gravestone.
A mason-dressed stone retrieved from the Invisible City.
A mason-dressed stone retrieved from the Invisible City. It is mysteriously light for its size, and tingles to the touch.
If it were gold, it might be worth something. But it's not, so it isn't.
They say all that glitters isn't gold...as is the case with this sand.
This ancient Gelmorran building block is covered on nearly every side by a thick blanket of emerald green moss.
An extremely heavy stone comprised of layers of river silt compressed down over thousands of generations.
A flat, uncracked stone, perfect for building or reinforcing walls.
There is a reason why no one wishes they had their weight in dirt, but dirt is all this rock has to offer.
It doesn't appear this stone contains any traces of gold, but perhaps the runes engraved upon it are directions to find the mother lode. Or perhaps it is a warning to not disturb this stone.
A flint stone sharpened at one end so vintners can use the edge to open sealed wine bottles, as well as start fires.
A shattered piece of Quarrymill's outer wall.

A special stone that is thought to contain the spirit of a Watcher─a lantern which lights the dark paths of the Twelveswood. Until it is carved and blessed by Stillglade Fane, it remains blind to its task, hence the name “unseeing stone.”
A piece of clouded glass which more than likely came from an ale growler.
A piece of colored glass which more than likely came from a wine bottle.
Rock containing a significant amount of the metal iron.
The remnants of shells discarded by people of the ancient civilization of Nym.
A bivalve mollusk native to the relatively calm waters of Moraby Bay. Due to overharvesting, they have grown quite rare...making them even more sought after.
Both sides of this tiny square of hard parchment are jam-packed with the life and times of traveling Lalafellin entrepreneur Roroton.
Leaner than aldgoat meat, but much more difficult to harvest due to the violent nature of the beast.
Since the Calamity, the popularity of tuco-tuco meat has grown to Dalamud-sized proportions.
A small iron key which opens the door to the captain's quarters in Dead Man's Drink.
A large iron key which unlocks Waverider Gate.
A crooked iron key which opens the door to the Hole in Dead Man's Drink.
A few words scrawled in code by Isembard of Drybone.
These red-hot cores are oft used to light churchwardens, censers, and candles, amongst other things.
A dead body ready for interment.
A strange slip of parchment found at the Amalj'aa encampment in eastern Thanalan.
A small slip of paper with Drowning Wench proprietor Baderon Tenfingers's unintelligible writing scrawled all about it.
Whatever language this missive is written in, it is one you are not familiar with.
An oddly shaped key which, if the markings on the shaft are to be trusted, will open the Runstop Headgate.
From cutting rope to removing barnacles, from gutting fish to gutting boarders─on a ship, there are thousands of uses for a knife.
A small lockbox entrusted to you by J'nasshym of the Brugaire Consortium.
Bags such as this one carrying merchandise are always attractive targets for highwaymen and bandits.
This waterskin is filled with more holes than water.
To be called a proper satchel, this would need an arm strap and a bottom.
One would not guess this brilliant plumage came from a bird known for dining on decaying flesh.
A heavy, dull piece of impure pyrite removed from the back of a coblyn.
The tough, glossy skin of a pre-molt softskin peiste. The demand for this item in Ul'dah is said to be lower than that for plague rat pelts.
A tiny yet elastic sack which aureliae periodically fill with seawater to keep them from floating off to the heavens.
The wind generated by these lighter-than-air cores is oft employed in the drying of fishes and meats.
These white-hot cores are sometimes used by fishers to stun fish so that they float to the water's surface, making them easier to catch.
Though the crate is splintered in several places, it does not appear that its contents were that severely damaged in the fall from the chocobo's back.
Several pieces of gold and silver jewelry hastily wrapped in a dirty square of tattered canvas.
The stench rising from this bag stuffed full of decaying cloudkin flesh is enough to blind a man.
This ancient receptacle may be from the fallen city of Belah'dia.
Over-aspected aether manifested into solid form.
A semisweet variety of grape which has adapted to the volcanic soil abundant on Vylbrand. This particular bunch has not long been off the vine.
This oddly shaped seed produced by any variety of landtraps is highly poisonous. Handle with caution.
If left be, this warm, heavy egg would likely hatch in a matter of weeks.
It would take quite the man (or woman) to drink this much ale in one sitting.
Poor judgment, poor balance, or perhaps a combination of both saw this perfectly good bottle of Sixth Astral Era reserve dropped into the sea.
A bitter-smelling liquid created by budding alchemist Alewyn Alder.
The disembodied middle finger of a voidsent bomb.
The deep-green glow emitted by the evenfall firefly is known to dispel the glamours of shape-shifting imps.
These red-hot cores are oft used to light churchwardens, censers, and candles, amongst other things.
This fine yellow powder will cause extreme irritation of the nose and lungs if inhaled.
This smoldering heart of a will-o'-the-wisp is said to have the power to reveal hidden secrets.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Fluid Corruption,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “The Noctambulist,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Igneous Toil,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Igneous Moil,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
This sprout growing from the head of the mandragora is responsible for photosynthesis.
The meat of the common pelican is too tough and too foul to eat...unless one elects to bypass the chewing process and swallow the pieces whole.
A concentrated elemental charge has left this crystal in a temporarily brightened state.
A tiny communication device used by the Garlean Empire to communicate over long distances. Designed to explode when taken too far from its owner, though this fail-safe has been known to malfunction.
These white-hot cores are sometimes used by fishers to stun fish so that they float to the water's surface, making them easier to catch.
The colorful shell of this bivalve mollusk is used to make jewelry or decorate the hilts of daggers and épées.
Obviously recorded from memory, the information on this list lacks any sort of detail.
A small statuette upon which is carved an aetherial flame.
A small statuette upon which is carved a bunch of grapes.
A small statuette upon which is carved a brilliant gem.
A small statuette upon which is carved a steel helmet.
Just like Fufucha's old ma used to make.
Add a few spikes and a leash, and this would kill at parties.
A nutrient-rich alchemic compound used to quicken seedkin growth.
This wooden box contains all manner of pointy instruments used by trappers when hunting their prey.
The thick white sap extracted from this ochu root has the power to grant its user wondrously terrible visions.
An important missive penned by Seedseer Kan<var 1F /var>E<var 1F /var>Senna and addressed to a sylph elder.
Almost large enough for a Lalafellin child, this cane appears more suited for a sylph than a man.
At a glance, this tender green leaf looks as if it could be from a gysahl green.
Legend says that Eorzea was once inhabited by a race of tiny creatures called brownies, and they would use the spores of this particular mushroom to paint their faces for battle.
A list of supplies and materiel to be delivered to a certain imperial stronghold.
A pure white silk gathered and spun by the sylphs using traditional methods passed down for countless generations.
A large wooden tub entrusted to you at Buscarron's Druthers.
The wooden tub entrusted to you at Buscarron's Druthers is now filled to the brim with cool river water.
When making an offering of antelope innards to the spirits of the wood, it is proper if they are still warm.
The spirits of the wood despise those creatures who shun harmony, such as the ravenous kedtraps. Offerings of the seedkin's petals will soothe the savage spirits.
A piece of pottery dating back to an age when the city<var 1F /var>state of Gelmorra prospered.
A clay pipkin packed with ground bomb fingers and claws and sealed with wax.
A weathered brass earring fitted with a polished scarlet stone. A favorite of the forgetful Qiqirn Teteroon.
A banded barrel large enough to hide a family of Lalafells. Fortunately, no families lurk inside at the moment.
A banded barrel filled with water from Fool Falls, large enough to serve as a bath for a family of Lalafells.
It takes almost a full year for a coeurl to grow its first whiskers. It took less than a minute to remove it.
Light and fluffy La Noscean toast, two boiled wildfowl eggs, a poached apkallu egg, and a cup of turtle egg soup─a veritable egg-lover's dream.
The ossified bone of some long-dead beast...or man!
The grooved pattern on this roundish fossil suggests it may be a shell of some sort.
A foul brew that is made by tossing various items found in the wild (both live and dead) into a barrel of water and letting the concoction ferment for a sennight under the warm sun.
A fragrant oil pressed from freshly harvested Azeyma rose hips.
The fluid lettering of Little Solace elder Frixio is as beautiful as it is unintelligible.
A small glass bottle the perfect size for collecting various blood samples.
The deep-red blood of a fattened vilekin. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
Used to frighten cloudkin away from farms and gardens. Despite the name, it has little effect on crows.
The deep-crimson lifeblood of a voidsent phurble. Remarkably, one of the hirsute creatures contains less than a half-score of drops.
At least you think it is a letter. As you cannot decipher the writings, there is always the possibility that it could be something completely different.
Data gathered on the ruins below Highbridge. Intended for delivery to Sister Kyokyozo at Thal's Respite.
A petition to Highwind Skyways to open an airship route to Highbridge.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood that, when placed on wet wood or leaves, will create a billowing tower of smoke that can be seen for malms.
Not to be confused with cactuar fruit, which, while similar in color, flavor, shape, texture, toxicity, hardness, and rarity, is nothing like its sabotender counterpart.
Thanalan spring water blessed by an anointed priest of the Order of Nald'thal. It is believed this holy item can quench infernal flames.
A piping hot infusion of freshly picked young Thanalan tea leaves mixed with rich aldgoat cream and a generous spoonful of golden cactuar flower honey.
A sister of the faerie apple developed by the Greatloam Growery to better withstand the elements, while yielding larger harvests.
A great battleaxe passed down through the generations until it finally fell to Cuthbert.
A strong-smelling herb used in salads, fish dishes, or to flavor distilled liquors.
A flavorful liquid made from salt and fermented Mun<var 1F /var>Tuy beans.
This particular specimen is almost twice as long as a normal horn. How it grew to this size in a single season is baffling.
If one is to believe Buscarron, this sour-smelling paste from Ala Mhigo will stop a wound from festering.
A quickly drawn up letter addressed to one Gundobald.
Its strong, sour smell would give it away if used in food or drink, but it works just fine when applied to weapons or used in poison potions.
A hollowed-out wooden tube filled with several onzes of firesand. Used in mines and tunnels to pulverize large boulders and clear away cave-ins.
Bigger than a shard, but not quite large enough to be a cluster. The energies emitted by this crystal lightly tingle the hands of any who touch it.
A key to a private room at the Bobbing Cork.
A detailed account of the events that have occurred near Fallgourd Float.
Having been left uncovered for a few days, this cheap Aleport brew has lost all of its bubbles.
A ceramic pot made of metal-free clay and fired in a ceruleum oven to lower aetherial conductivity.
Though removed from the body, this heart of a golem still throbs with magicks.
A simple duster woven from chocobo feathers. No chocobos were harmed in the making of this handy household cleaning tool.
Contains a brief letter written in shorthand by a tiny man.
Goods stolen from the merchant Gogolata by Qiqirn bandits.
The Bobbing Cork's realm-famous basket lunch, filled with freshly made finger food from the forest.
This simple lamp can warm the heart of a lonely soul...when it is properly filled with oil.
An underdeveloped voidsent balloon thrashes about inside the globe, ready to self-destruct at any moment.
Used for reaching those out-of-reach places.
A lily sigil is carved into this tiny ivory button.
The underside of this colorful funguar cap is packed with scores of gills, each containing innumerable spores.
The glass used to create this receptacle is over a half an ilm thick. Needless to say, whatever it is that goes inside will be well protected.
If one can consider a drifting semi-sentient mass of elementally charged aetherial matter 'alive.'
Cloudy water gathered from Hopeseed Pond.
When used as bait, a fish this size is sure to attract even the largest of beasts.
Almost as large as an aldgoat leg, but several times leaner.
Legend says that Eorzea was once inhabited by a race of tiny creatures called brownies, and they would use the spores of this particular mushroom to paint their faces for battle.
From myrrh to sandalwood, the soothing aromas emitted by these alchemically crafted incense cones will instantly take one back to the Jewel of the Desert.
A long piece of planed wood dropped by the ever-graceless Florent.
An exceptionally large egg with a seemingly unbreakable shell. When it hatches, the baby adamantoise that emerges will likely be as large as a hound.
The bright frothy blood of a drachen scalekin. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
A trophy claimed by U'odh Nunh from the dying hands of an Amalj'aa warrior.
A confusion of teeth, bones, and claws strung onto a piece of leather. Supposedly from the pattern in which items are ordered, other Amalj'aa can glean the name and rank of the necklace's wearer.
A few more bells under the sun and this fish will turn ripe as a faerie apple.
A sharp claw-like protrusion taken from the leg of a russet yarzon.
What ever would you put in an empty angler-sized sack?
What ever could be floundering about in this angler-sized sack?
A deep caramel-colored spirit made from twice distilling fine red wine and then aging it in rosewood barrels for at least thirty summers.
A simple burlap sack filled by Kuzai Tazai with several freshly cut slabs of dodo meat.
Several onzes of blasting powder packed into a hollowed-out gourd and affixed with a simple fuse long enough to give the lighter time to toss the makeshift device away without losing his hand.
A bronze medal engraved with the head of a mythical beast that somewhat resembles a Miqo'te.
An order made out to Wineport vintner Shamani Lohmani.
A light, porous wood used in sealing wine bottles.
Shamani Lohmani's first attempt at winemaking. At least the name sounds legitimate.
The beautifully patterned hide of a coeurl native to Raincatcher Gully.
Sap of a palm tree fermented inside an island coconut shell. Far more potent than wine made from grapes, palm wine, if brewed for too long, can cause loss of eyesight or even death.
A cutting from a Bacchus grape vine─a variety of sweet wine grape thought to be long extinct.
A vintage wine from the year 1547 of the Sixth Astral Era.
The wind generated by these lighter-than-air cores is the bane of beskirted women (and bekilted men) across the realm.
Due to the tendency of the flowers to grow randomly from its long hard stalks, the roselle makes a terrible bouquet.
Sautéed Wellwick worm, a soft-boiled adamantoise egg, and a goblin cheese soufflé.
A colorful selection of fragrant wildflowers. The perfect accent to any meal.
A vintage wine from the year 1547 of the Sixth Astral Era.
A formal request by one Blaugybal to be reinstated into his former Maelstrom unit.
This could be the largest warmwater trout ever to have lived. Past tense.
Superstitious smallfolk believe one gains the memories of any being he eats. Ask yourself this─do you truly wish to know how this warmwater trout lived?
The magick-imbued heart of a golem.
A six-ilm retractable claw found on the velociraptor's middle toe, used to slice the bellies of its prey. This handicaps the victims, ensuring they are still alive when the raptor begins to feed.
While certainly large enough to fit a coeurl, you worry how the bag will fare against a score of razor-sharp claws.
You shudder to think a thin layer of burlap is all that separates you from a flurry of fangs and claws.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood that can be used to light fuses much like the ones found on kobold-built explosives.
A thick, sticky oil collected from the underbelly of a river-dwelling salamander.
Sour red cooked with various spices and citrus rinds over a low flame so as to preserve the alcoholic content.
Heated in the warm springs beneath O'Ghomoro, this mulled wine is said to cure countless ailments. And those ailments it cannot cure, it will help one forget.
Ice-cold water gathered from Bronze Lake.
What appears to be the pitiful remains of distilling equipment used by alchemists to work their magic.
Unlike carpenter's chisels which have flat heads, the bull-point chisel has a pointed one and is used by expert goldsmiths to perforate soft metals.
This tool is oft employed by goldsmiths or clockwork engineers to seize and manipulate minuscule pieces of wire.
By some manner of clockwork wizardry, this strange contraption can precisely measure and follow the twenty-four bells in a single turn of the sun.
When lit, this incense releases a citrus-like aroma that most vilekin abhor.
A heavy leather pouch entrusted to you by Brother Esmour. It must contain hundreds of coins.
A heavy leather pouch entrusted to you by Sister Zozoru. You cannot begin to guess how much coin it might contain.
Crisp, buttery cookies dusted with a hint of fragrant cinnamon.
How you are able to fit this stiff Scion of the Seventh Dawn corpse into your bag is a mystery best left unsolved.
The sylph's peaceful expression belies the fact she no longer lives.
In addition to being tattered, it is also frayed, torn, moth-eaten, lice-ridden, and stained with what appears to be blood. You get what you pay for.
The arm of a sabotender del sol. The fleshy interior holds a surprising amount of fresh, drinkable water.

Literally meaning “water of the sun,” Aqua del Sol was originally brought back by expeditions to the New World far across the Indigo Deep. Not long after, Eorzeans began making their own variation of the drink from the sabotenders and cactuars of Thanalan.
With a decent wind, the stench of rotting dodo meat can carry for malms, attracting all manner of creatures.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
This letter of introduction was penned by Francel.
This wood has been dried and chopped, and is ready to toss on a fire.
Mutton any fresher would still be attached to the karakul's back.
Soft and fluffy, this skin would go perfect in front of a fireplace.
What looks silver is not always silver (but most of the time it's silver).
The only thing dull about this knife is its luster. The blade, on the other hand, appears sharp enough to cut through bone.
The rough white hide of a mountain-dwelling snow wolf.
A thick, sturdy rope twisted from common brambleweed. Sheepherders oft employ the rope in tying up the legs of their stock before sending them to market.
A young male karakul named Sebastian bound with brambleweed rope.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood that can be used to light bonfires.
When boiled in water, the bark of this rare yew found growing only in the Twelveswood turns black as pitch.
A neatly drafted report of Ixali activity in Coerthas.
The disembodied middle finger of a voidsent bomb.
A hastily drafted report of Ixali activity in the Black Shroud.
The brand of an unbeliever and enemy of the Holy See.
A thesis written by Alka Zolka on the proper habiliments of a scholar.
The deep blue-green sap extracted from the tiny leaves of this fleshy plant was once used across Vylbrand to dye cloth.
A long, complex refining process has removed almost 99% of all impurities from this ceruleum, making it suitable for fuel.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
A rare, expensive intoxicant made with the water from the Weeping Saint.
Carved from elementally aspected crystals by noble-born Juline of Ishgard.
A standard rosary carried by followers of the Ishgardian Orthodox Church and the Holy See.
Countless readings over countless generations have left this old tome faded and worn.
Volume six of astroscope readings taken at the First Dicasterial Observatorium of Aetherial and Astrological Phenomena in the year 1572 of the Sixth Astral Era.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A sealed scroll addressed to Lord Drillemont of House Durendaire and carelessly dropped by Nivie.
A cross section of meat sliced from the tail of a spotted mudpuppy. The bone has not been removed.
The rubbery texture of mudpuppy meat will ensure your jaws grow exhausted before your belly grows full.
The worldly possessions of a heretic delivered from his sins.
Chinchilla fat is oft used by Ishgardian monks to create the tallow they use for their candles.
The diamond-hard, fire-resistant scale of a mighty Dravanian.
Even after death, its beady eyes glare at you with what can only be described as a deep-seated hate.
A lavish blend of unnecessarily expensive ingredients based on a recipe conceived at the Alchemists' Guild in Ul'dah.
So cold, these cores are said to freeze the very air around them, making them perfect for cooling drinks on an especially hot day.
The scroll contains what appears to be an official papal appointment to the position of inquisitor.
The bloody remnants of a broken weapon left on the field of battle.
A powerful concoction which induces severe anger and acute madness.
A rusted iron key used to unlock the dungeons at Whitebrim Front.
A heavy tool used to chip away at rock-hard sheets of ice.
This sweet distilled spirit warms from the inside.
This brambleweed rope twisted from several thinner ropes appears strong enough to support the weight of a grown Roegadyn.
A simple vessel that will most likely last longer than its maker.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
It would not be a lie to say that this sledgehammer was made for harvesting corrupted crystals.
The deep-crimson lifeblood of a voidsent snurble. Remarkably, one of the hirsute creatures contains less than a half-score of drops.
This variety of colorless quartz can often be found mixed in with the other precious stones growing on a doblyn's back.
This brilliant feather reflects light as if it were actually made of gold.
Nary a drop of sweet ambrosia remains within.
The bottle contains a briny vintage found in tuns recovered from the sea.
A blend of exotic spices imported from well beyond the Sea of Jade.
A fragrant mist created by collecting the essential oil of Azeyma roses via an arduous distillation process.
A tiny black seed gathered from a sylvan lily found growing in the Black Shroud.
The wind generated by these lighter-than-air cores has the force to send a man's hat sailing over five score yalms.
This bright blood-colored ore is thought to be a symbol of loyalty and honesty.
This particular sample happens to be covered in spriggan offal...
An aetherially charged mass of energy taken from an ectoplasmic entity.
An aetherially charged mass of energy taken from a plasmoid.
Various items gathered from a razed campsite.
A sealed communication decorated with gold leaf and raised lettering.
A sealed communication decorated with a pressed dry flower.
A sealed communication contained in an ordinary, yellowing envelope.
The prized possession of a gigas who no longer possesses the capacity to possess it.
Prized by beastman witch doctors for its supposed ability to increase virility.
The spindly white roots of a mare's tail─an aquatic plant that earns its name from its uncanny resemblance to a chocobo tail.
A charred sheet of metal torn from the rusting carcass of a fallen imperial dreadnaught-class airship.
A complex-looking device that can detect the strength of electromagnetic waves.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The scars of war cover both back and front of this piece.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The scars of war cover all sides of this piece.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The outer layer has been repaired to appear good as new.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The outer shell has been repaired to appear good as new.
When lit, this tube emits a continuous plume of white smoke. Used to inform others of one's current position.
The clockwork soul of a mammet.
A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Used to deactivate certain magitek security terminals.
The thin transparent wing of a ked.
Members of the Maelstrom ground levy known as the Red Swallows use these bronze tags to identify the bodies of their fallen brothers.
This type of hastily thrown together explosive is used by the Red Swallows as a part of their fight-and-flight battle tactics.
A colorful account of the Red Swallows' heroic contributions during an operation to demolish a recently constructed kobold furnace.
Blasting powder used to clear tunnels in mines, though twenty-four onzes is a tad overkill.
A traditional blend of herbs and sandworm blubber used by warriors of the U tribe to soothe battle-weary joints and muscles.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
A simple explosive device employed by the Maelstrom levies in battle.
Each serving contains two pieces of fishtack, a dried herring, and a ginger cookie.
Forget that you are eating the raw gelatinous umbrella of a flying jellyfish and you might just enjoy it.

Only those who have never eaten basilisk meat claim it has the consistency of chicken. Those who <var 1A 02 /var>have<var 1A 01 /var> eaten basilisk meat will tell you the consistency is more akin to boot leather...as is the flavor.
A hodgepodge of basilisk meat, random roots, and whatever other edible flora (and fauna) can be foraged from the desert.
One of these blades is presented to each of the Immortal Flames infantry in a simple wooden box lined with velvet.
Claws are thought to contain the same flammable gases found in the bodies of voidsent grenades, therefore extreme caution is recommended when handling.
What exactly Memezofu was thinking when blending together every potion on his person, we shall never know.
The thin transparent layer of skin which covers the eye of a voidsent ahriman.
A writ of permission granting free passage through the otherwise off-limits White Wolf Gate in New Gridania.
A thesis written by Alka Zolka on the proper habiliments of a scholar.
The deep blue-green sap extracted from the tiny leaves of this fleshy plant was once used across Vylbrand to dye cloth.
The finishing touches are all that await these fine pieces of scholarly raiments.
The final remains of the wandering Padjal, A<var 1F /var>Towa<var 1F /var>Cant.
A wooden cargo crate used by Mealvaan's Gate to train new assessors.
Both sides are filled with letters and markings unlike any you have seen in Eorzea.
A spell tome entrusted to you by Arcanists' Guild guildmaster K'rhid Tia. The leather binding is uncracked and its pages are still crisp.
A short list of orders drafted by Mealvaan's Gate assessor K'lyhia.
Herring so fresh it still flaps its fins in one final desperate attempt to propel itself from your back, through the air, and back into the sweet saltwater it once called home.

The culinarian Opylona would have you believe her <var 1A 02 /var>homemade<var 1A 01 /var> eel pie is far more delicious than Mother Miounne's realm-famous <var 1A 02 /var>handmade<var 1A 01 /var> eel pie.
A leather purse filled to bursting with gil.

The veil of mystery surrounding this otherwise ordinary sack is so thick it could suffocate an aurochs. Extended poking and prodding reveals that the contents may include a tunic (or tablecloth), a book (or cutting board), and a pair of glasses (which are now most likely bent beyond repair).
A colorful cotton undergarment worn for countless summers by the dancer Ealdgyth.
Wine so old, no one alive can remember when it was bottled. The cork appears to still be intact.
Just like Fufucha's old ma used to make.
Add a few spikes and a leash, and this would kill at parties.
You can sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
This malodorous lifeblood of the Amalj'aa black mage is so dark a red, it almost appears black.
A quaint keepsake made from a single tiny crystal.
The shrill tone emitted by this bone-carved whistle is believed to summon minions of the Dravanian Horde.
Proof you (or someone else) slew Greywine.
The dull glow of this soul crystal tells a tale of neglect.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption borrowed from Widargelt used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
Shriveled hearts removed from the lifeless husks of three forsaken souls who were, until recently, undead.
Strange yet beautiful runes have been carved upon the surface of this otherwise normal-looking crystal.
An ordinary bag containing ordinary beans...or <var 1A 02 /var>are<var 1A 01 /var> they!?
The shrill tone emitted by this bone-carved whistle is believed to summon minions of the Dravanian Horde.
Collected directly from the comb. If the bees are hungry, they will simply have to make more.
A simple glance will not reveal what strange ingredients were used to brew this curious concoction.
A spicy dish made from sparhawk eggs and powdered bomb claws.
The pungent and highly corrosive secretion of an antlion.
If the purpose of this unnaturally green potation is to overwhelm unwary passersby with its noisome odor, then the experiment was a success.
The thick white sap extracted from this ochu root has the power to grant its user wondrously terrible visions.
The ossified bone of some long-dead beast...or man!
A large round slice of Wellwick worm white meat.
An aromatic spice native to the Black Shroud used to liven up bland dishes.
One of the secret ingredients used when brewing Mun<var 1F /var>Tuy sauce.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This warded pot contains a corrupted crystal.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This warded pot contains a corrupted crystal.
A letter of introduction penned by Portelaine.
A slip of parchment granting you crossing to the Isles of Umbra.
A beautiful antique ring worn by Lancefer's wife.
A single streak of bright-yellow fat runs through this otherwise lean chunk of porcine flesh.
A list documenting all recent sightings of the elder primal Odin.
Forget that you are eating the rancid gelatinous umbrella of a flying jellyfish and you might just enjoy it.
Designed by master smith Mimidoa, these earplugs can block out almost any sound, including the song of the infamous siren.
A standard-issue blade for all Garlean infantry.
The bundle appears to contain food rations and a flask of drinking water.
This particular brandewine has been aged in cherrywood barrels, giving it a sweet aroma and a deep amber hue.
After smoothing out the crumpled piece of parchment, you are able to discern a list of findings scrawled upon it.
This brambleweed rope twisted from several thinner ropes appears strong enough to support the weight of a grown Roegadyn.

To make cactus tea, sabotender fruit is dried, ground into a fine powder, and then left to sit a full night under Menphina's gaze to frighten away the spirit of the sabotender that dwelled inside the seeds. The powder is then added to boiling water and stirred until a foam forms upon the water's surface. The foam is given to break fever, the remaining liquid discarded under a rock found to the north of the patient.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A sister of the faerie apple developed by the Greatloam Growery to better withstand the elements, while yielding larger harvests.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A potent potable brewed from sabotender fruit by desert aldgoat herders to help them forget the fact they are aldgoat herders.
The crimson blood of a recently slain karakul. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The body of this poor soul has been defiled in more ways than one.
The source of a stroper's bad breath can be found within.
The sharp, wide blade is perfect for removing sea life attached to foundation pillars.

The pungent odor of this hard yellow cheese veined with blue-green mold is most comparable to the warm, damp boot of a zombie after stepping in ripe chocobo dung. Goblins claim it is a delicacy, but then again, they have their masks to filter out the aroma.
A stunning bouquet of roses named after Azeyma, the Warden.
The envelope contains what appears to be an official papal appointment to the position of inquisitor.
What looks silver is not always silver (but most of the time it's silver).
Uses for a simple sledgehammer #172: destroying locks on wooden boxes.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
A trophy taken from the corpse of a kobold priest of the 129th Order.
Bitter tears shed by balor's bells.
The thumb of a three-fingered voidsent bomb...or is it the index finger...or the ring?
A highly combustible substance found in the furnace-hot bellies of fire sprites.

It is believed that flame drakes breathe fire by gnashing their flint-like teeth together until a spark ignites the oily slaver secreted in their heat-resistant maws, which they then spit out onto their prey.
The pristine hide of a white wolf. The color of each individual strand of fur is not white, but actually clear.
Unbearably hot to the touch, this appendage torn from a voidsent napalm will remain hot for moons after the death of the host.
Mutton so tender and juicy, it will slide right off the bone.
A sample of Coerthan soil taken to test to see if it is suitable for growing crops.
A bloody lump of sinewy hippogryph meat. Several feathers still dangle from the flesh.
The tough yet flexible tendon of a biast.
So cold, these cores are said to freeze the very air around them, making them perfect for choking the truth out of devilish voidsent who seek to torment others with their deceiving glamours.
Both sides are filled with letters and markings unlike any you have seen in Eorzea.
The leather binding of this recently crafted tome is uncracked─its pages still crisp.
A short list of orders drafted by Mealvaan's Gate assessor K'lyhia.
Herring so fresh it still flaps its fins in one final desperate attempt to propel itself from your pack, through the air, and back into the sweet saltwater it once called home.

The culinarian Opylona would have you believe her <var 1A 02 /var>homemade<var 1A 01 /var> eel pie is far more delicious than Mother Miounne's realm-famous <var 1A 02 /var>handmade<var 1A 01 /var> eel pie.
A leather purse filled to bursting with gil.
The veil of mystery surrounding this otherwise ordinary sack is so thick it could suffocate an aurochs.
A colorful cotton undergarment worn for countless summers by the dancer Ealdgyth.
Wine so old, no one alive can remember when it was bottled. The cork appears to still be intact.
Almost large enough for a Lalafellin child, this cane appears more suited for a sylph than a man.
A solid piece of granite suitable for mending walls.
A solid piece of granite suitable for mending almost anything made of stone.
Several moons of snowfall, compacted and hardened to near rock-like consistency.
A dense chalky substance that, when ground into a powder, can be used to make glass.
A rare variety of mythril which emits a soft blue glow.
A rare variety of mythril which emits a soft blue glow. This particular sample appears to contain very few impurities.
A piece of compacted ice and snow hewn from towering Snowcloak.
A piece of compacted ice and snow hewn from towering Snowcloak. This piece is almost completely transparent.
This light colored mineral is mixed with conventional iron by Ishgardian blacksmiths to create what they call “white steel.”
A solid piece of granite suitable for hurtling at invading dragon hordes, as well as building walls.
A slice of partially frozen soil taken from the area near Whitebrim.
A slice of completely frozen soil taken from the area near Whitebrim.
A charred piece of the <var 1A 02 /var>Agrius<var 1A 01 /var>'s metal hull.
An intact square of the <var 1A 02 /var>Agrius<var 1A 01 /var>'s heat-resistant outer shielding.
Unaspected crystals as these are found across Mor Dhona, suffocating all life from the area.
A small, smooth stone featuring in its center a single carved symbol representing...something that cannot quite be made out.
Though it maintains the shape it held before its transformation, there is no living matter remaining whatsoever in this tree root.
Though it maintains the shape it held before its transformation, there is no living matter remaining whatsoever in this tree trunk.
Though regarded throughout the realm as highly toxic, Ishgardian physickers are still known to prescribe the herb as an emmenagogue.
Though regarded throughout the realm as highly toxic, Ishgardian physickers are still known to prescribe the herb as an emmenagogue. The young leaves are especially potent.
Straighter than the road upon which a true Ishgardian knight treads, this log hewn from a mature oak tree will make a fine wall or barricade.
This variety of weed grows flush with the ground, making it difficult to pull.
The broken branch of an unidentifiable tree, smoothed by its journey down the Coerthas River.
The trunk of an unidentifiable tree, torn from the hillside in some terrible storm and carried downstream by the mighty Coerthas River.
The larvae of these colorful beetles bore into firs and pines and drain the trees of their lifeblood.
This thick piece of bark is riddled with holes where spotted longicorn larvae have bored into the wood.
Those not made into arrow shafts will be shipped to the local orphanages, where they will be passed out to crotchety old wardens, who will use them to redden the arses of misbehaving boys and girls.
A rare variety of teak that can withstand the frigid climes of Abalathia's Spine.
The cut on this piece of bark could be an encrypted message left by a heretic...or it could be simply a cut.
The cut on this piece of bark is definitely a message left by a heretic for his unbelieving brethren.
To the untrained eye, these specimens are little more than weathered potsherds. However, to a learned naturalist, they are weathered <var 1A 02 /var>potsherds<var 1A 01 /var>.
A small, smooth stone featuring in its center a single carved symbol representing one of the Twelve.
The fact that it is long and sturdy, yet not too thick as to be cumbersome, makes this log perfect for erecting scaffolding.
Grass has never been more beautiful.
The tip of this root remains untouched by the slowly spreading crystals, the unaffected portion somehow still alive.
The roots of this trunk remain untouched by the slowly spreading crystals, the unaffected portion somehow still alive.
The pronged waves on the edge of this deadly head allow for easier entry into a target's flesh, while making it more difficult to remove.
The magick-imbued heart of a chert golem.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This particular sample happens to be covered in spriggan offal...
The giant bone of a Dravanian.
A small piece of blackened metal that may be from the outer shielding of the now-fallen satellite Dalamud.
A paper ward inscribed with a prayer to the patron deity of Ala Mhigo, Rhalgr.
A transparent gem discovered within ruins of the long-lost Allagan Empire.
You sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
You sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
New handwear for a white mage, or handwear for a new white mage?
New legwear for a white mage, or legwear for a new white mage?
New footwear for a white mage, or footwear for a new white mage?
New headgear for a white mage, or headgear for a new white mage?
A new habit for a white mage, or a habit for a new white mage?
The final remains of the wandering Padjal, A<var 1F /var>Towa<var 1F /var>Cant.
The brands of unbelievers and enemies of the Holy See.
A broad green leaf from a thought-to-be-extinct Bacchus grape vine.
A box that resembles a piece of Allagan masonry, containing a to-scale replica of the Crystal Tower carved from crystal.
The charred remnants of three ashkin hearts─proof that you have overcome Jenlyns's trial.
This strangely warm crystal was given to you by an equally peculiar knight.
A fragrant mist created by collecting the essential oil of Azeyma roses via an arduous distillation process.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The lifeblood of the Ixali black mage. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The thin ink-like lifeblood of the kobold black mage. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The warm blood of an adventurer whose adventuring days are now done. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
A nauseating blend of seemingly random alchemic ingredients mashed up in a mortar and diluted in a bath of stagnant water.
A potent liquor created through the fermentation of hornet carcasses.
A clear glass bottle filled to the brim with cold water.
An exceptionally pungent vinegar made from the fermenting of Coerthas-grown apples.
A linen pouch stuffed with hot pepper powder which can blind a man for several bells if thrown in his eyes. Always wash hands after handling.
Gridanian spring water blessed and imbued with purifying magicks by Brother O<var 1F /var>App<var 1F /var>Pesi.
The finishing touches are all that await these fine pieces of scholarly raiments.
This stone may have been the only thing preventing the elder primal Odin's return to Eorzea, and now the stone is destroyed.
The sylph's peaceful expression belies the fact she no longer lives.
A periodic account of happenings in and around the hamlet of Aleport. After recent events, one might assume that this particular report will read more akin to a letter of apology.
The elastic wing of a dusk bat.
A sealed missive addressed to Maelstrom sergeant, Wiltswys.
Contrary to popular belief, pelicans are highly poisonous creatures that spray their victims with a powerful neurotoxin.
This white wine made from the green lowland grapes of La Noscea is said to have a bold citrus flavor with hints of apple, pear, and cinnamon. But most sailors simply claim it “tastes like wine.”
White, six-petaled flowers with bright orange-yellow centers.
Countless years of use have seen the blade dulled and nicked, and the haft worn smooth.
A detailed map of the Amalj'aa stronghold in southern Thanalan.
A potent potation containing the blood of a freshly slain phurble, ground marimo, and several other grotesque ingredients that are best left unspoken.
A potent potation containing the blood of a freshly slain snurble, fermented sea pickles, and several other grotesque ingredients that are best left unspoken.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Cinerary Rite,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
Some say it tastes like chocobo, but most simply do not eat it.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Pale Oblation,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
